meanings.definition: A person or thing that roars loudly.
meanings.sent1: The lion at the zoo was one of the loudest roarers.
meanings.sent2: The crowd of fans at the concert were enthusiastic roarers.
meanings.sent3: The little kitten thought it was a mighty roarer when it meowed loudly.
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm outside sounded like a chorus of roarers in the night.
meanings.sent5: The engine of the old car was a constant roarer as it drove down the street.

meanings.definition: A group of people or animals that roar loudly.
meanings.sent1: The pack of lions in the savanna were known as fierce roarers.
meanings.sent2: The protesters outside the government building were passionate roarers.
meanings.sent3: The family of bears in the forest were quite the noisy roarers during the night.
meanings.sent4: The sound of the ocean waves crashing against the shore was like a distant group of roarers.
meanings.sent5: The choir of frogs near the pond were the nightly chorus of natural roarers.
